title: David Grossman - Novels & Non-Fiction (11 books)
description:
DAVID GROSSMAN (b. 1954) is an internationally acclaimed Israeli novelist and peace activist.  His books have been translated into more than 30 languages and won numerous prizes.  Alongside Amos Oz, he has been one of the most prominent cultural advocates of a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.


The 8 novels and and 3 works of non-fiction included here were originally uploaded by livhre, who kindly gave me permission to reproduce them here.  They are all in EPUB format:

* BE MY KNIFE (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 2001).  Translated by Vered Almog and Maya Gurantz.

* THE BOOK OF INTIMATE GRAMMAR (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1994).  Translated by Betsy Rosenberg.

* HER BODY KNOWS: Two Novellas (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 2005).  Translated by Jessica Cohen.

* LION'S HONEY: The Myth of Samson (Knopf, 2006).  Translated by Stuart Schoffman.

* SEE UNDER: LOVE (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1989).  Translated by Betsy Rosenberg.

* SLEEPING ON A WIRE: Conversations with Palestinians in Israel (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 2003).  Translated by Haim Watzman.

* THE SMILE OF THE LAMB (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1990).  Translated by Betsy Rosenberg.

* SOMEONE TO RUN WITH (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 2004).  Translated by Vered Almog and Maya Gurantz.

* TO THE END OF THE LAND (Knopf, 2010).  Translated by Jessica Cohen.

* WRITING IN THE DARK (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 2008).  Translated by Jessica Cohen.

* THE ZIGZAG KID (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, 1997).  Translated by Betsy Rosenberg.
